verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:13
verses.text: The occasion for the death of these saints was found in the vicinity of that most famous palace which was built by Adrian at his country seat at Tiber, according to Spartianus.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:14
verses.text: For when the emperor gave orders that this palace, which he had built for his pleasure, should be purified by some piacular ceremonies, the priests seized this opportunity for accusing Symphorosa, alleging that the gods would not be satisfied until Symphorosa should either sacrifice to them or be herself sacrificed; which last thing was done by Hadrian, whom, from many others of his deeds, we know to have been exceedingly superstitious, about the year of Christ , that is, about the beginning of his reign, at which period indeed, as Dio Cassius observes, that emperor put a great number to death.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:15
verses.text: The memory of these martyrs, moreover, is celebrated in all the most ancient martyrologies, although they assign different days for it.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:34
verses.text: When Adrian had built a palace, and wished to dedicate it by that wicked ceremonial, and began to seek responses by sacrifices to idols, and to the demons that dwell in idols, they replied, and said: "The widow Symphorosa, with her seven sons, wounds us day by day in invoking her God.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:35
verses.text: If she therefore, together with her sons, shall offer sacrifice, we promise to make good all that you ask".

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:36
verses.text: Then Adrian ordered her to be seized, along with her sons, and advised them in courteous terms to consent to offer sacrifice to the idols.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:37
verses.text: To him, however, the blessed Symphorosa answered: "My husband Getulius, together with his brother Amantius, when they were tribunes in thy service, suffered different punishments for the name of Christ, rather than consent to sacrifice to idols, and, like good athletes, they overcame thy demons in death.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:38
verses.text: For, rather than be prevailed on, they chose to be beheaded, and suffered death: which death, being endured for the name of Christ, gained them temporal ignominy indeed among men of this earth, but everlasting honour and glory among the angels; and moving now among them, and exhibiting trophies of their sufferings, they enjoy eternal life with the King eternal in the heavens".

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:39
verses.text: The Emperor Adrian said to the holy Symphorosa: "Either sacrifice thou along with thy sons to the omnipotent gods, or else I shall cause thee to be sacrificed thyself, together with thy sons".

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:40
verses.text: The blessed Symphorosa answered: "And whence is this great good to me, that I should be deemed worthy along with my sons to be offered as an oblation to God?" The Emperor Adrian said: "I shall cause thee to be sacrificed to my gods".

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:41
verses.text: The blessed Symphorosa replied: "Thy gods cannot take me in sacrifice; but if I am burned for the name of Christ, my God, I shall rather consume those demons of thine".

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:42
verses.text: The Emperor Adrian said: "Choose thou one of these alternatives: either sacrifice to my gods, or perish by an evil death".

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:43
verses.text: The blessed Symphorosa replied: "Thou thinkest that my mind can be altered by some kind of terror; whereas I long to rest with my husband Getulius, whom thou didst put to death for Christ's name".

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:44
verses.text: Then the Emperor Adrian ordered her to be led away to the temple of Hercules, and there first to be beaten with blows on the cheek, and afterwards to be suspended by the hair.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:45
verses.text: But when by no argument and by no terror could he divert her from her good resolution, he ordered her to be thrown into the river with a large stone fastened to her neck.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:46
verses.text: And her brother Eugenius, principal of the district of Tiber, picked up her body, and buried it in a suburb of the same city.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:47
verses.text: Then, on another day, the Emperor Adrian ordered all her seven sons to be brought before him in company; and when he had challenged them to sacrifice to idols, and perceived that they yielded by no means to his threats and terrors, he ordered seven stakes to be fixed around the temple of Hercules, and commanded them to be stretched on the blocks there.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:48
verses.text: And he ordered Crescens, the first, to be transfixed in the throat; and Julian, the second, to be stabbed in the breast; and Nemesius, the third, to be struck through the heart; and Primitivus, the fourth, to be wounded in the navel; and Justin, the fifth, to be struck through in the back with a sword; and Stracteus, the sixth, to be wounded in the side; and Eugenius, the seventh, to be cleft in twain from the head downwards.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:49
verses.text: The next day again the Emperor Adrian came to the temple of Hercules, and ordered their bodies to be carried off together, and cast into a deep pit; and the pontiffs gave to that place the name, To the Seven Biothanati.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:50
verses.text: After these things the persecution ceased for a year and a half, in which period the holy bodies of all the martyrs were honoured, and consigned with all care to tumuli erected for that purpose, and their names are written in the book of life.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:51
verses.text: The natal day, moreover, of the holy martyrs of Christ, the blessed Symphorosa and her seven sons, Crescens, Julian, Nemesius, Primitivus, Justin, Stracteus, and Eugenius, is held on the th July.

verses.name: Julius Africanus: The Passion of St. Symphorosa and her Seven Sons 1:52
verses.text: Their bodies rest on the Tiburtine road, at the eighth mile-stone from the city, under the kingship of our Lord Jesus Christ, to whom is honour and glory for ever and ever, Amen.
